page.title: 04SHOTESHAM/HOWE FARM 1 CROPS
page.content:
{HORTICULTURE}13 acres are worked as a market garden. Parsnips, lettuce, leeks, beetroot, cabbage, sprouts, radish, spring onions and rhubarb are grown on a rotational basis. Crops are sold locally to Norwich, Wymondham and Diss.
{FARMING}is mixed arable, farms being between 65 and 350 acres. {CROPS}of sugar beet, wheat, oats, and winter beans are grown on a four year cycle. Barley may be grown in between this cycle. Care is taken to grow legumes as a Break crop to prevent White Straw Grain disease. {MEADOWS}if difficult to fence are cropped as hay.
Conservation on farms tend to reflect a farmer's personal interest.
